title: Here's The Businesses El Pasoans Are Hoping for at The “Shoppes at Solana” - klaq.com
content:
Welp, it’s been a fun ride, Sunland Park Mall. Now it’s time for us locals to get used to saying “The Shoppes at Solana.”

Why, you ask? That’s because Sunland Park Mall has a new owner and with that comes a brand new name, too.

It was announced that Sunland Park Mall was bought by the president and owner of Starr Western Wear which currently has a location at the westside mall.

The new owner, Enoch Kimmelman, is hoping to bring back life to what he calls the crown jewel of the Westside.

Kimmelman hopes to turn the mall into a place where families can enjoy entertainment, food, and of course some shopping!

Along with being the new owner of Sunland Park Mall, Kimmelman also told local media that he will rename the mall: "The Shoppes at Solana."

Courtesy: The Shoppes at Solana Courtesy: The Shoppes at Solana loading...

The mall (formerly known as Sunland Park Mall) will remain open during construction, but if you plan on heading out to the mall just keep a heads up for construction because they will be doing all construction in phases to avoid disrupting and current businesses at the mall.

It’s no secret that Sunland Park Mall has been struggling over the past several years especially during the pandemic so although this news may be a bit shocking to some, I’m hoping that the change will turn Sunland Park Mall into what it used to be back when I was a teen.

When the news was announced, many locals had mixed reactions. I wanted to see what stores locals would like to see in the “new” mall and some of these ideas were pretty great! Take a look at what businesses El Pasoans wouldn't mind seeing at the Shoppes at Solana:

IL IL loading...

Do you agree with this list?

In-N-Out

IKEA

Cheesecake Factory

Trader Joes

Yardhouse

New York & Co.

Zara

A real Ice Skating Rink

Nordstrom

Disney Store

TAKE A LOOK AT OTHER SUGGESTIONS:

title: Solana-Based Altcoin Project Rallies After Coinbase Announces Support for Trading - The Daily Hodl
content:
An altcoin project on the Solana (SOL) network is rallying after top US crypto exchange Coinbase announced the digital asset will soon be listed on its platform for trading.

According to a new announcement, Coinbase plans to list Helium (HNT) beginning Wednesday when appropriate liquidity conditions are met.

Says Coinbase,

“Coinbase will add support for Helium (HNT) on the Solana network. Do not send this asset over other networks or your funds may be lost. Transfers for this asset are available on [Coinbase] in the regions where trading is supported.

Trading will begin on or after 9am PT on 12 July 2023, if liquidity conditions are met. Once sufficient supply of this asset is established trading on our HNT-USD trading pairs will launch in phases. Support for HNT may be restricted in some supported jurisdictions.”

Helium soared to a high of $1.48 Wednesday after Coinbase announced it would list the peer-to-peer wireless hot spot project. Helium is trading for $1.44 at time of writing, up from a 14-day low of $1.19, a more than 21% increase.

Coinbase is adding support for Helium under its “Experimental Label,” a designation for riskier, lower liquidity tokens.

Helium is a network for the Internet of Things (IoT) that operates in a decentralized manner. It enables IOT devices connected to the network to communicate and share data by supporting smart contracts and enterprise applications. The network rewards participants, including those who set up Helium hotspots, with the HNT tokens.

The project aims to offer more efficient and cost-effective wireless coverage for IoT devices compared to traditional networks.

Coinbase first added Helium to its listing roadmap at the end of June.

title: Crypto community with 92% historical accuracy sets Solana price for July 31 - Finbold - Finance in Bold
content:
Disclaimer: The CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency community price estimate is based only on the votes of its users. Estimates do not guarantee end-of-month prices.

The price trajectory of Solana (SOL) has undeniably captivated the attention of numerous investors in the last week, as this asset has demonstrated a remarkable surge, ascending by an impressive 17% within the past seven days.

Resuming its ascent, Solana has managed to surpass the psychologically significant threshold of $20, testing the resistance level at $22. However, for astute crypto traders, the forthcoming critical juncture lies in Solana’s quest to recapture the coveted $30 mark, a price point it has not attained since June 2023.

Against the backdrop of the latest price developments surrounding this digital asset, Finbold sought SOL predictions from the crypto community at CoinMarketCap on July 13. These valuable inputs are crucial in order to gauge the prevailing atmosphere surrounding this decentralized finance (DeFi) cryptocurrency, which has recently been the center of attention.

Based on the insights gained from the community’s voting patterns over the past six months, which have shown a historical accuracy rate of 91.95%, Solana is predicted to trade at an average price of $22.48. This projection reflects a marginal increase of 2% from its current price at the time of publication.

CoinMarketCap community’s SOL price prediction for July 31. Source: CoinMarketCap

Solana June estimate

Considering the community’s most recent price estimate for the end of June, their success rate in predicting the price of Solana stood at an impressive 89%.

CoinMarketCap community’s SOL price estimation accuracy over the past six months. Source: CoinMarketCap

However, it is crucial to recognize that past performance does not guarantee future results. While the community’s track record is noteworthy, it is essential to consider other factors that can influence the price of SOL in the future.

SOL leads top 100 cryptocurrencies in 7-day gains

It is worth highlighting that Solana has emerged as the frontrunner regarding gains within the cryptocurrency market when considering the top 100 digital assets over the past week.

CoinMarketCap top 100 gainers past week. Source: CoinMarketCap

The assets following Solana in this regard are Compound (COMP) and Polygon (MATIC), further solidifying the impressive performance of SOL during this period.

Solana chart analysis

Solana is currently trading at $22, reflecting a modest 0.1% increase in price for the day. Over the past week, SOL has experienced a remarkable surge, appreciating 17%.

SOL seven-day price chart. Source: Finbold

Examining SOL’s recent performance, it is worth noting that out of the past 30 trading days, SOL has had 20 green days, accounting for approximately 67% of the observed period.

Nevertheless, Solana has experienced a significant price decline over the past year, with a notable decrease of -34%. This performance places the token below the average performance of 78% of the top 100 crypto assets during the same period. Furthermore, major cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum have outperformed the digital asset.

Considering these factors, investors should exercise caution and conduct thorough analysis before making any investment decisions related to SOL. The current price trends, underperformance compared to other cryptocurrencies, trading below the 200-day moving average, overbought conditions, and the substantial decline from its all-time high all suggest a challenging market environment for SOL in the recent past.
